name.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: EarlyBird Jobs - Simplify your job search

short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Sorting and Filtering tool for the LinkedIn recommended jobs feed!

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
LinkedIn shows you recommended job postings based on your profile, but does not allow you to sort or filter these postings to get rid of the noise. The result of this is that the majority of the shown job opportunities already have hundreds of applicants or were posted weeks/months ago. EarlyBird is a simple extension that makes use of LinkedIn's recommended jobs feature to retrieve relevant jobs and allows you to sort and filter them with criteria such as posting date, applicant count, keywords, and location. Get ahead of the competition by discovering fresh job opportunities on LinkedIn before they become crowded with applicants! 🔍💼

Be First, Get Noticed
Stop wasting time scrolling through job listings with hundreds of applicants. EarlyBird Job Finder helps you identify and prioritize newly posted positions and opportunities with fewer applicants, significantly increasing your chances of getting noticed by recruiters.

Key Features
🔥 Sorting: Organize LinkedIn job recommendations by applicant count, posting date, and salary
🔥Filtering: Filter recommended postings by including/excluding specific keywords, location, company and more
🔥 Seamless Integration: Convenient sidebar interface that works directly within LinkedIn
🔥 Real-Time Updates: Refresh job listings with a single click
🔥 User-Friendly: Simple setup process and intuitive controls

How It Works
1️⃣ Install EarlyBird Job Finder
2️⃣ Visit LinkedIn.com
3️⃣ Ensure your "Open to Work" setting is activated
4️⃣ Access the EarlyBird sidebar by clicking the expand arrow
5️⃣ Click "Refresh Jobs" to start discovering opportunities

Perfect For
✅ Active job seekers
✅ Career changers
✅ Recent graduates
✅ Professionals seeking new opportunities
✅ Anyone wanting to stay ahead in their job search

The github repo for the extension is available here: https://github.com/poweroutlet2/earlybird-extension
